actor_awards.notes: The patriarch of the Huston acting dynasty, father of director John Huston and grandfather of Anjelica Huston. He won the Academy Award for Best Supporting Actor for 'The Treasure of the Sierra Madre', directed by his son. He was a highly respected stage and screen actor known for his commanding presence.

filmography.title: The Treasure of the Sierra Madre
filmography.role_description: A wise and grizzly old prospector who teaches his younger companions about mining gold and the dangers of greed.
filmography.plot: Two down-on-their-luck Americans searching for work in 1920s Mexico convince an old prospector to help them mine for gold in the Sierra Madre Mountains.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Supporting Actor; Golden Globe: Win – Best Supporting Actor

filmography.title: Dodsworth
filmography.role_description: A retired auto magnate who travels to Europe with his younger, social-climbing wife, only to find their marriage unraveling.
filmography.plot: A retired auto manufacturer and his wife take a long-planned European vacation only to find that they want very different things from life.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Actor; New York Film Critics Circle: Win – Best Actor

filmography.title: The Devil and Daniel Webster
filmography.role_description: A charismatic and sinister personification of the Devil who steals a farmer's soul.
filmography.plot: A farmer sells his soul to the Devil for seven years of good luck and prosperity, then asks Daniel Webster to defend him in court.

filmography.title: Yankee Doodle Dandy
filmography.role_description: The father and vaudeville partner of the legendary showman George M. Cohan.
filmography.plot: The life of the renowned musical composer, playwright, actor, dancer, and singer George M. Cohan.

filmography.title: The Furies
filmography.role_description: A tyrannical cattle baron who engages in a bitter feud with his headstrong daughter.
filmography.plot: A headstrong daughter clashes with her cattle baron father over the ownership of their ranch, The Furies.

filmography.title: And Then There Were None
filmography.role_description: A doctor with a secret past who becomes one of the ten victims on an isolated island.
filmography.plot: Seven guests, a newly hired personal secretary, and two staff are gathered for a weekend on an isolated island by an unknown host, who accuses each of them of murder.
filmography.awards: Locarno International Film Festival: Win – Best Film

filmography.title: Rain
filmography.role_description: A zealous and hypocritical missionary who tries to reform a prostitute named Sadie Thompson.
filmography.plot: A self-righteous missionary tries to reform a streetwalker on a South Sea island, but his own repressions lead to tragedy.

filmography.title: Gabriel Over the White House
filmography.role_description: A corrupt U.S. President who suffers a car accident and wakes up divinely inspired to become a benevolent dictator.
filmography.plot: A corrupt President of the United States suffers a near-fatal car accident and wakes up a changed man, determined to save the country.
filmography.awards: National Board of Review: Top Ten Films

filmography.title: Abraham Lincoln
filmography.role_description: Huston portrays the 16th President of the United States in this D.W. Griffith biopic.
filmography.plot: A biography of Abraham Lincoln from his birth to his assassination, focusing on his presidency during the Civil War.

filmography.title: The Virginian
filmography.role_description: A villainous cattle rustler who clashes with the title character.
filmography.plot: A good-natured cowboy courts a schoolteacher and has to deal with a cattle rustler and a friend who goes bad.

filmography.title: Mission to Moscow
filmography.role_description: The U.S. Ambassador to the Soviet Union whose memoirs serve as the basis for the film.
filmography.plot: A recounting of the experiences of the U.S. Ambassador to the Soviet Union just before World War II.

filmography.title: Dragon Seed
filmography.role_description: The patriarch of a Chinese farming family struggling under Japanese occupation.
filmography.plot: Chinese peasants fight to survive the Japanese invasion of their village during World War II.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Supporting Actress (Aline MacMahon)

filmography.title: Duel in the Sun
filmography.role_description: A fire-and-brimstone preacher who tries to save the soul of the film's heroine.
filmography.plot: A half-Native American woman is sent to live with her white relatives, sparking conflict between two brothers.

filmography.title: American Madness
filmography.role_description: An idealistic bank president who believes in lending money based on character rather than collateral.
filmography.plot: During the Great Depression, a bank robbery leads to a run on the bank, testing the president's faith in his customers.

filmography.title: Kongo
filmography.role_description: A crippled, vengeful magician ruling over an African outpost, seeking revenge on the man who paralyzed him.
filmography.plot: A paraplegic white man rules an African area by superstition and sadism, plotting revenge on the man who crippled him.

filmography.title: The Beast of the City
filmography.role_description: An honest police captain determined to bring down a powerful gang leader.
filmography.plot: A police captain is appointed chief and vows to clean up the city, but his brother's weakness could be his undoing.

filmography.title: Law and Order
filmography.role_description: A retired lawman based on Wyatt Earp who cleans up a lawless town.
filmography.plot: A famous lawman and his brothers try to bring order to the violent town of Tombstone.

filmography.title: Summer Holiday
filmography.role_description: The understanding father of a young man coming of age in a musical adaptation of 'Ah, Wilderness!'.
filmography.plot: A musical slice of life in a small New England town at the turn of the century.

filmography.title: The Outlaw
filmography.role_description: The legendary gunslinger who befriends Billy the Kid in this controversial western.
filmography.plot: Billy the Kid and Doc Holliday fight over a horse and a woman while Sheriff Pat Garrett tries to keep the peace.

filmography.title: Edge of Darkness
filmography.role_description: A Norwegian doctor and community leader involved in the resistance against Nazi occupation.
filmography.plot: After two years of German occupation, the people of a Norwegian fishing village rise up against the Nazis.

filmography.title: The North Star
filmography.role_description: A Russian doctor who confronts the Nazi invaders in his village.
filmography.plot: Ukrainian villagers must fight back when the German army invades their land during World War II.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Writing, Original Screenplay

filmography.title: Ann Vickers
filmography.role_description: A judge who falls in love with a social reformer played by Irene Dunne.
filmography.plot: A naive social worker exposes the terrible conditions in a prison and falls in love with a controversial judge.

filmography.title: Keep 'Em Rolling
filmography.role_description: A soldier who forms a deep bond with a horse named Rodney.
filmography.plot: A hard-drinking soldier refuses to be separated from his horse when the army decides to mechanize.

filmography.title: Storm at Daybreak
filmography.role_description: A Serbian mayor who is assassinated, triggering a complex chain of events.
filmography.plot: A Hungarian officer saves a Serbian assassin from execution, leading to a love triangle involving the mayor's wife.

filmography.title: The Prizefighter and the Lady
filmography.role_description: A fight promoter who discovers a talented boxer.
filmography.plot: A boxer rises to fame and falls in love with a nightclub singer, but his ego threatens his success.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Writing, Original Story
